RT @UKELA_LAW: Welcome to all attending our #Waste Law After #Brexit webinar this pm. We're fully booked & excited to hear from:   
üëè@jacob‚Ä¶

@EnvAgency @EmmaHowardBoyd The Environment Agency harms the environment. EA just approved Europe's biggest incinerator for rural Essex. Belching out 625,000 tns CO2 pa plus double WHO safety limits of cancer-causing particulates. Lining the pockets of greedy companies at the expense of public health.

text: @TimCrossleyACC @SHinchcliffe @MichaelBrannan @bradfordmdc @kersten_england @KerstenEngland For those in Bradford City Centre, this is a temperature inversion. If an incinerator was built here, toxic emissions would be trapped in the valley, even more than usual. @EnvAgencyYNE why has no specific modelling been done for this unique valley topography? #keighley #bingley

urls.title: Home - Wildlife Ways
urls.description: Wildlife Ways is a ¬£16.8 million programme, part-funded by the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF), to improve Solihull borough for the benefit of people and wildlife. It will include tree, bulb and wildflower planting and make it easier for people wanting to walk and cycle by widening and connecting paths and cycle routes with green spaces.

text: RT @SoliLandscape: Busy day today - Next stage of ERDF https://t.co/sdweOZi0gu Kinghurst Brook re-naturalisation project in #Chelmsley Wood‚Ä¶

Closing tomorrow...

The historic concrete culvert in a tributary of the Torridge represented a barrier to fish movement. The old quarry track was no longer used and the landowner agreed to the culverts removal, opening up >2km of watercourse upstream to fish @EnvAgency #WEG #TRRP https://t.co/8096LIr5kJ
